author: Seton, Ernest Thompson, 1860-1946

quoteFirst: Joseph Frasier, being duly sworn, deposes and says: I live at 331 West 37th Street, New York City. On August 15th, at
quoteLast: in the night, I was on my way to work on an 8th Avenue car going downtown. A crowd rushed towards the car and yelled, "Lynch the nigger!" A policeman who jumped on the car hit me on the head with his club and knocked out a tooth and beat me on the arms, back, and body until I was nearly senseless.
title: Story of the Riot
author: Moss, Frank [Compiler]

quoteLast: , it is half past eleven, it is quarter of twelve_." All she can think of in connection with this curious incident is the recollection that her father liked to see his grown-up children appear punctually at the general meal hour.

quoteFirst: His last wakeful recollection was of the clock in the lower corridor striking the first
quoteLast: ; then sleep claimed him, and he knew no more until all the stillness was suddenly shattered by a loud-voiced gong hammering out an alarm and the sound of people tumbling out of bed and scurrying about in a panic of fright. He jumped out of bed, pulled on his clothing, and rushed out into the hall, only to find it alive with people, and at their head Sir Henry, with a dressing-gown thrown on over his pyjamas and a bedroom candle in his shaking hand.
title: Cleek: the Man of the Forty Faces
author: Hanshew, Thomas W., 1857-1914

quoteLast: on the night of Tuesday, January 9, we started, having rolled up all our belongings that we did not require in the sleeping bags, and these, in turn, in the tent. This made one big bundle, which we jammed under the rock as far as possible and weighted down with stones, so that it should not be blown away.
title: A climber in New Zealand

quoteLast: in a truly grateful and religious frame of mind.

quoteFirst: With many lovely fields on either side of us we drove at a smart pace towards Bielle (181/4 miles), and at a
quoteLast: entered the town, which in bygone days was the capital of Ossau. Here the celebrated Coffre d'Ossau, that contained archives dating from the year 1227, was kept; and it is a noteworthy fact that the presence of the mayors of three towns, besides that of the President of the Valley Council, was necessary before this "strong box" could be opened.
